bibl.title: For You, Arsinoe ...
bibl.note: P. Mil. Vogl. VIII, 309: the role of the Ptolemies, and in particular of Arsinoe II within the epigram collection. - I. Arsinoe as warrior. - II. Geopoetics. - III. Patroness of the Arts.

bibl.title: Labored in Papyrus Leaves: Perspectives on an Epigram Collection Attributed to Posidippus (P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309)

bibl.seg: Benjamin ACOSTA-HUGHES, Elizabeth KOSMETATOU and Manuel BAUMBACH (Edd.), Labored in Papyrus Leaves: Perspectives on an Epigram Collection Attributed to Posidippus (P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309) = Hellenic Studies. 2 (Washington, D.C. - Cambridge, Mass. - London, 2004) pp. 161-176.
P. Mil. Vogl. VIII, 309: the role of the Ptolemies, and in particular of Arsinoe II within the epigram collection. - I. Arsinoe as warrior. - II. Geopoetics. - III. Patroness of the Arts.
